newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary sugarbeet area down to 100,000 ha - industry.
newsitem.headline: Hungary sugarbeet area down to 100,000 ha - industry.

text.p: Hungary's sugarbeet crop is expected to be smaller this year but will still cover domestic demand, industry sources said on Thursday.
"The planted area will be 101,361 hectares, over 93 percent of which is already sown," Andras Angeli, Chairman of the Sugar Industry Association (SIA), told Reuters.
He added that the planted area was some 15 percent lower than last year's but that it would still more than cover Hungarian sugar demand.

"Last year, the sugar factories contracted some 115,000 hectares because in the spring Slovenia, Yugoslavia and Croatia signalled a need for some 600,000 tonnes of root," he said, adding that those countries eventually only bought 200,000 tonnes of beet equivalent.
"This left Hungary with a 60,000 tonnes sugar surplus and despite some indication for export demand, the industry is much more cautious this year," Angeli said.
He added that from this year's sown area the SIA expects a crop of some 4.1 million tonnes of beet compared with 4.7 million in 1996.
